channel.title: 1 Question
channel.description: How do I make it so a different object trains strengh? Well right now I have door's to train strengh (I'm using Fr33sc4p3) and I want a different object to train strengh. *sniff* i smell Mod Taharok in the atmosphere *sniff*, help me? Lol Anyways Please and thankyou!

item.title: 1 Question
item.dc:creator: @_R_E_B_O_R_N ~R E B O R N~
item.description:

Should i just make a new thing and add it into case 132? Because im not having any luck finding it in case 132. Or if you want i can post everything in case 132 on here. I’m confused lol.

Read full topic

item.title: 1 Question

item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

No, it is case 132, but im not sure about the id of the object that you want to change it to. just look for an objects list on the forums and then play around with the numbers in case 132 and see what happens.

item.description:
@_R_E_B_O_R_N wrote:

I searched the door’s ID number but I’m confused still… Is it one of these?

case 2559: ReplaceObject(objectX,objectY,1531, -2); break;

case 1533: if(objectX == 3183 && objectY == 3434) { ReplaceObject(objectX,objectY,1531, -1); } else { ReplaceObject(objectX,objectY,objectID =+ 2, 0); } break;

[code]println_debug("atObjectID: “+atObjectID+” atObjectY: “+atObjectY+” itemSlot: “+itemSlot+” atObjectX: “+atObjectX+” useItemID: “+useItemID+” j6: "+j6);

			}
                            if (useItemID == 4151 && atObjectID == 1531)
                            {[/code]

item.title: 1 Question
item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

Nope. Let me find it lol…

			case 132:
				int objectX = inStream.readSignedWordBigEndianA();
				int objectID = inStream.readUnsignedWord();
				int objectY = inStream.readUnsignedWordA();
				int face = 0;
				int face2 = 0;
				int GateID = 1;

That would be it. Now search for the object you are looking for (by search its ID) and change it to the object that you want to train strength.

Read full topic
